official-title.#text:
To amend title XVIII of the Social Security Act to permit the 2-year phase-in for changes in
			 hospital wage index classification from rural to urban without requiring
			 waiver of a wage index increase, and for other purposes.

cosponsor.#tail: ) introduced the following bill; which was referred to the

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#text: Section 1886(d)(13)(G) of the Social Security Act

header.#text:
Permitting 2-year phase-in of hospital wage index reclassification from rural to urban without
			 requiring waiver of wage index increase

quote.#text: (G)(i) Except as provided in clause (ii), a hospital

text.#text: by adding at the end the following new clause:

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#tail:
shall treat any hospital
			 described in this clause that reclassifies as rural under paragraph (8)(E)
			 during such two fiscal years as not having waived the application of the
			 wage index increase under this paragraph.

text.#text:
In the case of any hospital which is located in an area which, at any time after September 30,
			 2014, is reclassified from a rural to an urban area, such hospital shall
			 not be required to waive the application of a wage index increase under
			 this paragraph in order to be eligible for reclassification under
			 paragraph (8)(E) (related to treating hospitals as being located in a
			 rural area) for the first two fiscal years for which the reclassification
			 from rural to urban is effective. The

{http://purl.org/dc/elements/1.1/}title.#text: 113 HR 5531 IH: To amend title XVIII of the Social Security Act to permit the 2-year phase-in for changes in hospital wage index classification from rural to urban without requiring waiver of a wage index increase, and for other purposes.
